trans-unit.source: How to configure Google authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Google authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Google authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Google authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your application to use Google login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your application to use Google login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Mobile Apps to use Google as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Mobile Apps to use Google as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Google account that has a verified email address.
trans-unit.target: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Google account that has a verified email address.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Google account, go to accounts.google.com.
trans-unit.target: To create a new Google account, go to accounts.google.com.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], and navigate to your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], and navigate to your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: Copy your **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy your **URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this later with your Google app.
trans-unit.target: You will use this later with your Google app.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**, **User authentication**, and then click **Google**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**, **User authentication**, and then click **Google**.

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Redirect URI**.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Redirect URI**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your Google app.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your Google app.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the [Google apis](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=268303) website, sign-in with your Google account credentials, click **Create Project**, provide a **Project name**, then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the [Google apis](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=268303) website, sign-in with your Google account credentials, click **Create Project**, provide a **Project name**, then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation bar, click **API & Auth**, then under **Social APIs** click **Google+ API** > **Enable API**.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation bar, click **API & Auth**, then under **Social APIs** click **Google+ API** > **Enable API**.

trans-unit.source: Click **API & Auth** > **Credentials** > **OAuth consent screen**, then select your **Email address**, enter a **Product Name**, and click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **API & Auth** > **Credentials** > **OAuth consent screen**, then select your **Email address**, enter a **Product Name**, and click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Credentials** tab, click **Add credentials** > **OAuth 2.0 client ID**, then select **Web application**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Credentials** tab, click **Add credentials** > **OAuth 2.0 client ID**, then select **Web application**.

trans-unit.source: Paste the Mobile Apps **URL** you copied earlier into **Authorized JavaScript Origins**, then paste the **Redirect URI** you copied earlier into **Authorized Redirect URI**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the Mobile Apps **URL** you copied earlier into **Authorized JavaScript Origins**, then paste the **Redirect URI** you copied earlier into **Authorized Redirect URI**.

trans-unit.source: The redirect URI is the Mobile App gateway appended with the path, _/signin-google_.
trans-unit.target: The redirect URI is the Mobile App gateway appended with the path, _/signin-google_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/signin-google`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/signin-google`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: On the next screen, make a note of the values of the client ID and client secret.
trans-unit.target: On the next screen, make a note of the values of the client ID and client secret.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The client secret is an important security credential.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The client secret is an important security credential.

trans-unit.source: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.
trans-unit.target: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure Management Portal], on the Google settings blade for your Mobile App, paste in the Client ID and Client secret values which you obtained previously.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure Management Portal], on the Google settings blade for your Mobile App, paste in the Client ID and Client secret values which you obtained previously.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Google for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Google for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: Related Content
trans-unit.target: Related Content

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
